items.sentence: My English teacher recommended that I read these books.

Tom asked Mary to wait for him in front of the library.

You shouldn\'t give up just because you have no talent.
You shouldn\'t judge a person based on his or her name.
I can\'t play it from memory. Please give me the music.
I suspect that Tom doesn\'t do his homework by himself.
Tom needs to study more if he hopes to pass this class.
Tom never did anything for anybody, except for himself.
Tom never knew that Mary lived on the bad side of town.
Tom never pays much attention to what his teacher says.
Tom peeked in the window and saw Mary and John kissing.
Mary and her boyfriend were here together this morning.
Mary took a mirror out of her bag and handed it to Tom.
Mary wanted Tom to spend more time with their children.
Mary wants to buy a new dress. What do you want to buy?
Mary has had the same boyfriend since she was eighteen.
Mary pulled out her knitting needles and began to knit.
Even though I was wearing gloves, my fingers were cold.
I can\'t tell you how long I\'ve been waiting for this.

Tom was expelled from school for breaking school rules.

If you want security in your old age, begin saving now.
If you want to ask any more questions, you can ask Tom.
In spite of the bad weather, they decided to go by car.
In the future, many workers will be replaced by robots.
Tom is the only one in our office who can speak French.
Tom reached into his pocket and pulled out some change.
Tom shot the injured horse to put it out of its misery.
Tom tried in vain to convince Mary to go to art school.
Tom turned around to see what was happening behind him.
Tom was a little surprised by how well Mary could sing.
Tom was hoping he could learn how to live off the land.
Tom was looking at a picture of a person wearing a hat.

Tom and Mary are good friends, but they aren\'t dating.
Tom won\'t give Mary the message that you asked him to.

This stew tastes a lot better than the way I make stew.

Tom didn\'t ask whether Mary was planning to go or not.
